visual.name: cardWithStatesByOKViz
visual.description: Based on the Power BI built-in Card and KPI, the Card with States by OKVIZ allows you to bind a performance measure and to define multiple states that determine the color of the visual itself. Moreover, you can set a trend axis to display a the measure trend line. It is customizable in every single aspect.

dataRoles.description: (Required) Set the measure(s) to display. You can bind multiple measures in order to display multiple cards. In this case, the 'Category' field will be disabled.
dataRoles.name: Values

dataRoles.description: Set the column to define multiple cards. If you set a column here, 'Measures' and 'Targets' will accept a single measure each.
dataRoles.name: category

dataRoles.description: Set the target(s) of the card(s). This measure is used to calculate the card change and is considered the last condition to assign states. If you don't set it, the reference label is not available. If the 'Category' is empty, you can bind multiple measures here. In this case, you have to bind the same number of measures as in the 'Measures' section.
dataRoles.name: target

dataRoles.description: Set the measure to use to check states conditions. If you don't set it, 'Measures' is used. When multiple cards are displayed, leave this field blank.
dataRoles.name: TargetValue

dataRoles.description: Set measures to display dynamic states messages. The number of measures and their order must be the same as in the 'Conditions'
dataRoles.name: messages

dataRoles.description: Set a column to be displayed as a trendline.
dataRoles.name: axis

dataRoles.description: Set additional measures to be included in the card tooltips.
dataRoles.name: tooltips

showGallery.description: Show a gallery of built-in and user-defined templates for this visual.

showGalleryButton.description: Show a button in the lower right corner of the visual to view the templates gallery. The button appears only when the mouse is over the visual and the report in Edit mode.

online.description: Allow external templates from OKViz servers.

current.description: This string represents the template currently applied to the visual, including all your settings. You can copy and save it as JSON file. This file can be shared and loaded in the templates gallery of other instances of this visual. Note that you can also export the current template by using the Save button available in the templates gallery.

tooltipsShow.description: Show tooltips for each card. If you enable tooltips for the trendline, this option will be ignored.

cardsResize.displayName: Automatically resize text size to fit

aggregate.description: Select the value to display in the main label. By choosing 'Dynamic', the label will change according to the current mouse position over the trendline.

fillWithBackground.description: Select the color to assign when a state changes the background of the visual.

locale.description: Set the culture code used to format data. This code is determined automatically, but you can change it to fit your needs.

enumeration.displayName: English (St Helena, Ascension, Tristan da Cunha)

text.description: Display a custom string. You can mix static text with shortcodes: {target} for target value, {cur_name} for current data point, {prev_name} for previous data point, {prev} for previous value, {cat_name} for category name.

fillWithBackground.description: Select the color to assign when a state changes the background of the visual.

tooltipsShow.description: Show tooltips for trendline data points. If you set the data label value to 'Dynamic', this option will be automatically disabled.

fillWithBackground.description: Select the color to assign to the line when a state changes the background of the visual.

areaFillWithBackground.description: Select the color to assign to the area when a state changes the background of the visual.

advanced.description: 1) Decide which conditions to enable/disable; 2) Define multiple comparison operators, one for each condition; 3) Choose the order of conditions; 4) Define when a condition being met blocks the other conditions. To enable all these features, you need a Premium license.

baseFill.description: Set the color to apply to the relevant elements if no state is assigned. Choose 'No Fill' to use the default color of each element.

showMessages.description: Assign custom messages to every state. When enabled, some additional fields will appear on conditions section.

messageFillWithBackground.description: Select the color to assign the message when a state changes the background of the visual. Choose 'No Fill' to automatically assign the best color for the state.
